questions.question: Jason loves ________ loudly.
________ music is fun!
________ is important to your health.
Did you forget ________ last night?
________ too much Coke is bad for you.
It can be bad for you ________ too much Coke.
Do you enjoy eating sweets?

choices.answer: Is an example of an infinitive.
Is an example of a gerund.
Is actually the present progressive tense.

questions.question: It began ________.
I hope _________ Rome someday.
She went ________ yesterday.
I plan ________ home and ________ around.
Remember ________ a shower.
I remember ________ one yesterday.
Movies are fun ________.
I advise you ________ kind to others.
I plan ________ a millionaire in 10 years.
I enjoy ________ vegetables.
To be a famous actor would be great!

choices.answer: Is an example of an infinitive.
Is an example of a gerund.

questions.question: I love ________ and ________ soccer.
The woman _______ is singing is a musician.
In what row is the desk _______ Amy usually sits at?
Nancy, _______ brother works for McDonald's, is 23 years old.
Complete the sentence: This is the spot _______ I broke my arm.
Complete the sentence: The bike, _______ I bought last year, was stolen.
The coffee, _______ I drank yesterday, was too hot.
In which sentence can you delete who?

choices.answer: The man who owns the car is sleeping.
The boy who I ate lunch with already left.
The woman who sells ice cream is cold.

questions.question: The juice _______ sat on the counter for an hour was warm.
Combine these sentences: Jane ran a race yesterday. The race was a marathon.

choices.answer: The race, which Jane ran yesterday, was a marathon.
The race, which was a marathon, ran Jane yesterday.
Jane, who ran a marathon yesterday, is a marathon.
The race yesterday, which was a marathon, was called Jane.

questions.question: The book that I am reading is funny.
The man who you went to visit was gone.
Mandy, who I met in college, is 31 years old.
The song that is stuck in my head is annoying.
The book which is on the table belongs to me.
Combine the sentences: I bought a hairbrush. It broke the first time I used it.

choices.answer: I broke the first time that I used a hairbrush.
The first time that I bought a hairbrush it broke.
The hairbrush that I bought broke the first time I used it.

questions.question: I have two cars - which sentence is more correct?

choices.answer: The car, which is blue, broke down.
The car that is blue broke down.

questions.question: The only dog _______ I think is cute is my own.
That is the restaurant _______ we fell in love.
James, _______ mother is sick, is not here.
In which sentence can you delete that?

choices.answer: The dog that I bought is a puppy.
The cat that is white is yours.
Where is the boy that hurt himself?

questions.question: Is the following active or passive? I ate the pizza all by myself.
Is the following active or passive? The cake was baked with love.
Is the following active or passive? My choice was made after I saw her fall.
Is the following active or passive? Aliens are attacking Earth!
Is the following active or passive? Andy posted the picture on Instagram.
Which sentence is passive?

choices.answer: Alex kicked the ball very far.
The ball was kicked very far by Alex.

questions.question: Is the following active or passive? Have you ever seen Paris?
Is the following active or passive? He was met by a talking cat in his dream last night.
Is the following active or passive? The cold never bothered me anyways.
Is the following active or passive? The pretty snow is falling slowly.
Which sentence is active?

choices.answer: I lost my glasses and now I feel blind.
The loss of my glasses has left me feeling blind.

questions.question: Is the following active or passive? Where did the ball hit you?
Is the following active or passive? Follow me if you want to live!
Is the following active or passive? I was seen leaving the party, wasn't I?
Is the following active or passive? The eggs were not being eaten by the children.
Is the following active or passive? Her reaction to the surprise quiz shocked me.
Is the following active or passive? They could've vacationed in Arizona, but stayed in Regina.
Is the following active or passive? I was struck by lightning.
Is the following active or passive? You have been caught napping at school.
Is the following active or passive? This Kahoot was created by a tired teacher!
Complete the sentence: ...I would be rich.
If we ______ friends, we wouldn't be fighting.
If I ______ money, I would ______ more.
______ I anything to eat, I wouldn't be hungry.
Which sentence is correct?

choices.answer: If you were a millionaire, you could buy almost anything.
If you are a millionaire, you could buy almost anything.
If you were a millionaire, you could bought almost anything.

questions.question: If I ______ harder, I might have ______ my exam.
______ I won the lottery, I wouldn't need to work.
Which sentence is incorrect?

choices.answer: If you were a princess, you could wear fancy dresses.
If I was ill, I would not like it at all.
Had you seen it, you would believe it.

questions.question: Which sentence is incorrect?

choices.answer: If I had one wish, I would ask for more wishes.
If I left yesterday, I would had missed you.
I would have fallen asleep, if I weren't too cold.

questions.question: She would ______ him if she ______ his number.
Identify and correct the mistake: I will marry someone famous if I were a movie star.
Which sentence is correct?

choices.answer: If you found a wallet, what would you do?
If I was a cat, what would you think?
If you were a frog, where did you jump?

questions.question: If you ______ more healthy food, you would feel better.
If I ______ you, I'd ______ a new job.
Identify and correct the mistake: We wouldn't be late again when we bought a new car.
Which sentence is incorrect?

choices.answer: Were I to die, my friends would be sad.
If I learned how to fly, I might not be afraid of heights.
If I was a child, I would be short.

questions.question: If I ______ the lottery, I could ______ at 30 years old.
______ I more creative, I would write more interesting sentences.
Which sentence is correct?

choices.answer: If you were the last human on earth, what would you do?
If I was the last person on earth, I would be lonely.
Were I on earth alone, I might be finding a pet.

questions.question: If you could have any superpower, what would you choose?
Change the following into reported speech: "I love chocolate ice cream, but not strawberry."

choices.answer: She said she loves chocolate and strawberry ice cream.
She told me she loves chocolate, not strawberry ice cream.
She told she loves chocolate, but not strawberry ice cream.

questions.question: Change the following into reported speech: "I'm moving next Saturday."

choices.answer: He told me he was moving the following Saturday.
He said he will be moving last Saturday.
He told he will be moving last Saturday.

questions.question: Change the following into reported speech: They said, "We cannot stay for dinner today."

choices.answer: They told me they couldn't stay for dinner.
They said me they couldn't stay for dinner.
They said I cannot stay for dinner today.

questions.question: Change the following into reported speech: He said, "I didn't tell them anything."

choices.answer: He told me about telling me anything.

questions.question: Change the following into reported speech: "Where is the corner store?"

choices.answer: He asked me where the corner store was.
He said where the corner store was.
He replied where the corner store was.

questions.question: Match the reported speech to the spoken: He told me he has been living in Alaska since 2012.

choices.answer: "I have been living in Alaska since 2012."
"We have been living in Alaska since 2011"
"My son has lived in Alaska since 2012."

questions.question: Change the following into reported speech: "The sunset is beautiful."

choices.answer: He said, the sunset was beautiful.
He said the sunset was beautiful.
He says the sunset is beautiful.

questions.question: Match the reported speech to the spoken: They agreed to visit the zoo with us on Friday.

choices.answer: "Sorry, we have a wedding to go to on Friday."
"Sure, we can make it to the zoo on Friday."
"Can you come to the zoo on Friday?"
"We can make Saturday... want to go then instead?"

questions.question: Change the following into reported speech: She said, "He said he hates mushrooms."

choices.answer: He said that he hates mushrooms.
She said that he hates mushrooms.

questions.question: Change the following into reported speech: "But I love you!"

choices.answer: She is saying she loved him.
She said she had loved him.
She told me she loves you.

questions.question: Change the following into reported speech: He said he wants some orange juice.

choices.answer: He said, "I want some orange juice."
He said he wanted orange juice yesterday.
She said she wants orange juice.

questions.question: Change the following into reported speech: She said, "From now on, I will eat supper with you."

choices.answer: She said, from now on she would eat supper with him.
He said she should always eat supper with him.
She said from then on she would eat supper with him.
She said, "from then on she'd eat supper with him."

questions.question: Match the reported speech to the spoken: She suggested we take highway 11.

choices.answer: "Why don't you take highway 11? It is faster."
"You should take route 12 instead of highway 11."

questions.question: Change the following into reported speech: She said,"He, uh, baked pies for the yard sale."

choices.answer: She said she, uh, baked pies for the yard sale.
She said she baked pies for the yard sale
He said she baked pies for the sale.
She said he baked pies for the yard sale.

questions.question: Change the following into reported speech: "The boys were late to class for the third time."

choices.answer: The teacher said this is the third time the boys were late.
The teacher said the girls were late to class again.
The boys said the teacher was late for the third time.
The teacher said the boys were perfectly on time every day.

questions.question: Change the following into reported speech: "My son is trying to put the canoe in the water."

choices.answer: His brother said he's trying to put the canoe in the water.
His dad told me he was watering the canoe.
His dad said he was trying to put the canoe in the water.
His dad told me is sitting in the canoe on land.

questions.question: Match the reported speech to the spoken: The kids told me they saw the bears eat their lunch.

choices.answer: "We saw the bears eat our lunch!"
"They saw the bears eat their lunch!"
"We fed the bears our brother's lunch."
"We ate lunch with some bears today!"

questions.question: Change the following into reported speech: "I totally won the race!"

choices.answer: He said that he lost the race.
He argued that he won the race.

questions.question: Match the reported speech to the spoken: They said they didn't want help.
Match the reported speech to the spoken: They said they liked this quiz!

choices.answer: They said we like this quiz.
They said, "What quiz? I don't remember a quiz."
We said we like this quiz.
